info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON...SOUTHERN JEFFERSON...NORTHEASTERN BELMONT...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...OHIO... BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 516 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Clairsville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weirton, Steubenville, Martins Ferry, St. Clairsville, Warwood, Wellsburg, West Liberty, Avella, Clearview, Toronto, Wintersville, and Mingo Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio...southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
